intro: Aglaomorpha parkinsonii, commonly known as the Parkinson's aglaomorpha, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its attractive, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers full sun and well-drained soil.
